wikipedia_page.main:
John William Kentish (21 January 1910 – 26 October 2006) was an English operatic tenor.
Kentish was born in Blackheath, Kent, and was the elder brother of the painter David Kentish.
He died in Chipping Norton, Oxfordshire, aged 96.

response: * Music & Arts CD-618: Richard Lewis, (Cellini), Joan Carlyle (Teresa), Josephine Veasey, Ascanio, Don Garrard (Balducci), John Cameron (Fieramosca), David Ward (Cardinal Salviati), Richard Lewis, Ranken Bushby (Pompeo), John Kentish, innkeeper; BBC Symphony Orchestra and Chorus, Antal Doráti, live concert performance, Royal Festival Hall, London, 23.1.1963; reviews on 24.1.1963 by The Times, Evening Standard, Daily Express, Daily Telegraph
